definition: a world of ice and snow
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: and make that season of ice and snow more endurable.
sentences.chinese: 那歌声使冰天雪地的寒冬变得较易忍受。

sentences.english: This time I, it was the winter the withering grass, in a world of ice and snow in blur.
sentences.chinese: 此时的我，正是冬日枯萎的小草，在冰天雪地里迷离。

sentences.english: And make that season of ice and snow more endurable .
sentences.chinese: 那歌声使冰天雪地的寒冬变得较易忍受。

sentences.english: These wolves cover a lot of frozen ground.
sentences.chinese: 在这冰天雪地随处可见这些狼群。

sentences.english: The ship got lost and sailed too close to the icy Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 这条船迷航了，结果开得离冰天雪地的南极洲太近了。

sentences.english: What fabulous worlds lay out there, far beyond the ice?
sentences.chinese: 冰天雪地的彼端会是怎样一个奇妙的世界呢？

sentences.english: Arrive Antarctica, there snow and icebound, innumerable the penguin be welcome me.
sentences.chinese: 到南极大陆，那里冰天雪地，无数企鹅在欢迎我。

definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
brilliant white snow cover (esp. of distant peaks)
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
four seasons like spring/favorable climate throughout the year
